comment: I do think that this class is a good class and you will learn a lot but the only thing I will say is that he has a very strict no tolerance policy. If you accidentally miss a grade and email him to make it up or to do an extra credit assignment he will say no and there are no exceptions. I feel like he could apply a bit more grace to students.

I took his class in the fall, I think he is very funny and wants to get to know you. There is a discussion post every week on top of other assignments. He also is very strict on attendance, and if you miss his class you have the possibility of being kicked out? Hes a good guy, but strict and will make you talk in class. He was fine for one semester
Boring and repetitive class. Professor Kim is nice but his policies are terrible and he does not teach but then grades harshly.

I took him for Com Sources this semester. Super nice, funny guy. His lectures are pretty involved and he will more than likely call on you several times while he teaches. His announcements are very unclear but he tends to be pretty responsive and urges you to reach out with questions. Overall, the class wasn't bad just keep track of deadlines.

I would not recommend taking this class. Lectures were just him reading off of PowerPoints that you had most likely already read to do the discussion posts. Attendance was mandatory and he had a no excuses policy despite how utterly boring the class was. Take someone else if you can or take the class fully online if that's an option.

took for summer. didnt put much effort in it. just did the 300 word disccusion every week and submitted my videos , respond to ny peers posts and your done. I think there was like 2 essays on a movie analysis of your choice also. honestly easy.

Dr. Kim comes across as a very nice professor at first glance, but as the semester goes on, he becomes more strict on grading- almost to a fault.There is no legitimate grading scale, his syllabus is incorrect, and he provides zero context on assignments. Be ready to do work with no rubric or understanding of the assignment.
Great professor, your grade is made up of a research paper and presentation, weekly reading memos, and 2 exams. Responds quickly to emails and cares about his students
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This man reflects the typical college student, he cares enough to show up but not enough to make it interesting. He's a good guy but just a super mediocre class. I will leave him with the same thing he said about my paper "This represents a minimum but still adequate amount of work." Overall pretty easy class to get a B in.

Prof. Kim is very caring and tries to get to know his students. He hosted multiple zoom calls where you could come in and ask questions about papers and exams. My only complaint is we were forced into group projects where we had to write our final paper together. There wasn't too much work and he tried his best to help

Assigns huge papers and projects and gives absolutely no help at all. He encourages you to ask questions and then doesn't answer them or turns them back on you as if that's helpful. Would highly recommend taking a different professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Kim is a great professor. He is fun and witty and cares about students. If you have a problem with anything he is always willing to help. Textbook is required; many online assignments using the book if taking hybrid. 2 major papers done in groups. Medium grader. Tests aren't that difficult; he recycles questions from previous tests.

Prof. Kim is a great person and a good professor. He teaches off of ppts, which is helpful when his accent is hard to understand. I know it's probably not his choice but the school's, but making 4 people write a research paper together is irresponsible. He is a tough grader, so making sure 4 people's writing flows together is really hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I almost dropped this class the first week, but I decided to stick around. While the content is sometimes rough and two 15 page papers seem rough, he lets you get into groups of 4 which helps a TON. The first test was impossible, but as soon as I realized how he grades, it was way easier. I honestly would take him again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Kim is a hilarious teacher that tries to make class interesting and fun, but he is very unclear what the requirements are at times. You have two 15-page group research papers and 4 tests. Test are tricky but get easier as the semester goes on bc they are cumulative and he uses exact questions from last exams. Can only miss 3 classes

Heeman is a great professor! For my class he changed my test grade on every test because I gave a valid argument. There are 2 papers due, and you do not want to wait until the last minute. The tests are tricky, but as long as you study you'll be fine The final is almost a duplicate of the third test, so PAY ATTENTION.

Unless you are a robot don't take Kim... don't sit near people you will talk to because over the course of the semester he deducts points for talking even if you are talking to a neighbor about the class.. which is funny bc we are COMMUNICATIONS majors. Isn't clear on grading for papers. Tries to trick you on tests by wording some questions weird.

Prof. Kim is Korean, and at times his english can be a little hard to understand. However, he is always available to ask questions to, he is super funny, and the class had a really cool atmosphere where everyone was comfortable. Great guy, but his class can be difficult-- no homework, tests are tricky, two HUGE papers done in groups.

He is so funny and is super helpful if you reach out to him with questions. Don't be on your phone because he does pay close attention to who is participating and it will reflect in your grades. Papers are pretty time consuming but not difficult. Tests are relatively easy. Overall, just pay attention and show interest and you will do well!

Dr. Kim is awesome. Very funny smart guy. The course is quite a bit of work, but I really enjoyed class time with him and it was my favorite class of the semester. His tests are easy as they repeat material.  If you like to participate in class, and like a teacher that can light up a classroom, take him. Heeman is life.

Dr. Kim is hilarious, very VERY helpful, and great in general. I took him for a graduate-level course so that may be the difference; however, I had no complaints. Sure, his accent is a little thick. So what? Stop him and ask for clarification. If you can't understand something, it's on you. He has no problem repeating himself.

He has a bad accent, but you will get used to it. Class is boring, but he can be funny. Test are straight from the powerpoints he posts and are accumulative. 2 big papers that can be done in a group. I am not sure this class could be fun. Hard work but I got a B. Not to bad overall.

Do not take this teacher. You will never receive a straight forward answer to a question. Absolutely no electronics in class (take your notes by hand).  Low regard for women and minorities which is strange he is Korean. Extremely thick accent hard to understand.  All tests are cumulative.  Kim has a lot of issues, however, he is never wrong.
You will get use to his accent You must listen closely

The teacher was not helpful with answering questions.  He would say throughout feel free to come to my office with questions.  But when you went to his office he would be impatient and make you feel as if you are bothering him.
